meanings.definition: (Latin) to be dim, dark, or obscure; to grow dark; to be misty or foggy.
meanings.english_definition: (Latin) to be dim, dark, or obscure; to grow dark; to be misty or foggy.

usage_notes.explanation: *Caligare* is a Latin verb primarily used to describe the darkening of light, dimming of vision, or the presence of mist or fog. It is often used poetically or in descriptive writing.

readability_explanation.text: This is a Latin word, so readability is dependent on familiarity with Latin. It is not commonly used in modern English.
